text: English vocabulary lesson 17 topic
Pittsburgh Pennsylvania
you may know that I live in
Massachusetts but my home state is
Pennsylvania do you know where
Pennsylvania is it's on the East Coast
more specifically it's a mid-atlantic
state it's south of New York and it's
north of Washington DC Pennsylvania is
bordered by the states of New York New
Jersey Delaware Maryland West Virginia
and Ohio the capital of Pennsylvania is
Harrisburg you may know another city
Philadelphia but that's in the East I
went to college there my hometown of
Pittsburgh is over here in the West
where the three rivers meet
I recently took a trip back to
Pittsburgh and while it was there I
decided to grab my camera and head
downtown so I could show you and tell
you a little bit about my city
Pittsburgh is known for its three rivers
the Allegheny the Monongahela and the
Ohio rivers these three rivers come to a
point in fact we have a Park Point State
Park and it's down there here's a better
view of Point State Park well it's not a
pretty picture that's because at the
time the whole city was preparing for
the g20 summit everywhere you looked it
seemed like there was construction but
in this picture you can see how the
Allegheny and Monongahela rivers meet
the Ohio River there are a number of
expressions in English with the word
Point the one I'd like to share with you
is get to the point if you get to the
point then you state the purpose the
main idea you give an explanation
once again the expression is get to the
point example it took a long time for
the speaker to get to the point people
grew bored as they waited to hear his
main argument
now Pittsburgh is known as the Steel
City and that's because in the past
Pittsburgh had many mills and these
mills produce steel steel comes from
iron there's an idiom about having an
iron will if you have an iron will you
have determination a strong will
strongly leaves so it's not easy to
change your mind again the expression is
iron will example Jane had an iron will
and she didn't listen to anyone who told
her she couldn't run a business on her
own she did everything necessary to make
her company successful Pittsburgh is a
sports town Pittsburghers take great
pride in their sports team and right now
they can proudly claim the title of city
of champions and that's because they
have the football team that hits her
Steelers and the hockey team the
Pittsburgh Penguins and both teams have
won their championships
not one idiom related to their victory
is to blow the competition away if you
won the competition away you win easily
once again the expression is blow the
competition away example our school has
the best football team in the city we're
confident that we'll blow the
competition away this year just like we
did last year let's review our three
expressions what's the expression to
state or discuss what is most important
do you remember
get to the point look at common ways we
use this expression we say let's get to
the point get to the point
I'll get right to the point please note
that if you tell someone get to the
point it can sound a little impatient
even rude so you would need a close
familiar relationship with someone to
tell him or her get to the point what's
the expression great determination
meaning a strong belief in one's
decision or a strong sense of purpose
the expression is iron will and we often
talk about having an iron will what's
the expression to win easily to be the
clear winner
do you remember blow the competition
away note there is more than one
possible word order we could say blow
the competition away or blow away the
competition and there's one other
variation another idiom with the same
meaning blow the competition out of the
water and this refers to a battle or
combat at sea if one ship attacks a
second ship the explosion can blow that
second ship out of the water and
exercise 1 choose the correct expression
to complete the statement 1 read the
statement to yourself and then I'll tell
you the answer answer you can make a
dream come true if you have an iron will
just believe in yourself to answer let's
not waste any time and get to the point
the sooner we make a decision the sooner
we can take action it's also fine to say
get right to the point
answer Wow your resume looks great
you're sure to blow the competition away
no other candidate will have as much
experience as you do note we could use
the alternative word order blow away the
competition
exercise to answer the questions if
you're studying by yourself you can
write down your answers if you're with a
partner take turns asking the questions
one name someone you know with an iron
will how has this person's determination
helped him or her to name a sports team
that has blown the competition out of
the water in past years are you a fan of
this team 3 when you want to ask someone
a favor do you get right to the point
or do you take a long time to make your
request while making this lesson I
checked out these sources you may find
them useful to additional practice for
this lesson can be found at English cafe
comm my user name is Jennifer ESL follow
the direct link listed in the video
description in the exercise you'll
practice the three idioms from this
video and a couple more I think you'll
find interesting if you'd like to learn
more information about Pittsburgh
Pennsylvania please visit these sites
well that's all for now I hope you
enjoyed learning a little bit about my
hometown thanks for watching and happy
studies
